de.rincewind.api.gui.elements.abstracts

Interface Element

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventBased
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ElementBrick, ElementButton, ElementCounter, ElementDisplayable, ElementInfo, ElementInput, ElementItem, ElementList<T>, ElementMap<T>, ElementMultiButton, ElementOutput, ElementScanner, ElementSelector, ElementSizeable, ElementSlot, ElementSwitcher<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CraftElement, CraftElementBrick, CraftElementButton, CraftElementCounter, CraftElementDisplayable, CraftElementInfo, CraftElementInput, CraftElementItem, CraftElementList, CraftElementMap, CraftElementMultiButton, CraftElementOutput, CraftElementScanner, CraftElementSelector, CraftElementSizeable, CraftElementSlot, CraftElementSwitcher, Elements.ElementBrickExtendable, Elements.ElementButtonExtendable, Elements.ElementCounterExtendable, Elements.ElementDisplayExtendable, Elements.ElementExtendable, Elements.ElementInputExtendable, Elements.ElementItemExtendable, Elements.ElementListExtendable, Elements.ElementOutputExtendable, Elements.ElementScannerExtendable, Elements.ElementSizeableExtendable, Elements.ElementSlotExtendable, Elements.ElementSwitcherExtendable

    public interface Element
extends EventBased
    This is the basic element. All other elements extend from this class. Although this class contains the methods getWidth() and getHeight() you cannot change the size in this basic-element.
    Since:
    2.3.3
    Author:
    Rincewind34
    See Also:
    ElementDisplayable, ElementSlot

void setPosition(int x,
                             int y)
        Deprecated. because of the new class Point summarizing the x and y coordinate.
        Sets the position of this element.
        Parameters:

        See Also:
        setPoint(Point)

      • getPoint

        Point getPoint()
        Returns the position of this element.
        Returns:
        the position of this element

      • setPoint

        void setPoint(Point point)
        Sets the position of this element. Before changing the position, Modifyable.clearItemsFrom(Element) will be called and Modifyable.readItemsFrom(Element) after changing the position. If the x or y coordinate is negative or greater than the size of for example the window added this element to, this element may not be rendered.
        Parameters:
        point - to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the point is null

      • priorize

        void priorize()

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns the width of this element. In this class, you cannot change the size so the width is 1.
        Returns:
        the width of this element

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns the height of this element. In this class, you cannot change the size so the height is 1.
        Returns:
        the height of this element

      • setBlocker

        void setBlocker(ClickBlocker blocker)
        Sets the ClickBlocker for this element. The blocker blocks some InventoryAction-s for example like pickup or drop from/to the slot. By the default all actions are canceled.
        Parameters:
        blocker - to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the blocker is null

      • setVisible

        void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets the visibility of this element. If the visibility is set to false, the element will be replaced for example in the WindowColorable with the background of the window this element is added to.
        Parameters:
        visible - hiding this element if the value is false.

      • iterate

        void iterate(java.util.function.Consumer<Point> action)
        Runs a consumer for each point locatable in this element.
        Parameters:
        action - to run.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the action is null

      • enable

        void enable()
        Calls setEnabled(boolean) to set this element enabled.

      • disable

        void disable()
        Calls setEnabled(boolean) to set this element disabled.

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled(boolean value)
        Disables or enables this element. If an element many actions like pressing a button will be blocked.
        Parameters:
        value - to set

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Returns true if this element is enabled and false if not.
        Returns:
        true if this element is enabled and false if not

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        Returns true if this element is visible and false if not.
        Returns:
        true if this element is visible and false if not

      • getBlocker

        ClickBlocker getBlocker()
        Returns the ClickBlocker set to this element.
        Returns:
        the ClickBlocker set to this element
